This vignette introduces the generic compendium structure and shows how to
access configuration and the input manifest without loading the package.

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(comment = "#>", collapse = TRUE)
```

```{r}
# Read config and manifest using fully-qualified calls
cfg <- rcompendium::cfg_read()
mf  <- rcompendium::read_manifest(cfg$data$manifest)
mf
```

If you've executed the pipeline (`targets::tar_make()`), you can also read
targets directly:

```{r}
# targets::tar_read(manifest_summary)
```
